intro: Elwendia badachschanica, commonly known as the Badakhshan elwendia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-like flower clusters. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
